input.description:
The name of the parent resource pool from which the new resource pool will be created.
Valid value: String

Name of the new resource pool.
Valid values: String

Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the resource pool. Units are MHz.
Valid values- Number

In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation on a resource pool can grow beyond the specified value, if the parent resource pool has unreserved resources. A non-expandable reservation is called a fixed reservation.
Valid values - true, false

The utilization of a resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of resource pools independent of available resources. If set to -1, then there is no fixed limit on resource usage (only bounded by available resources and shares). Units are MHz.
Valid values - Number

The number of shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention. This value is only set if level is set to custom. If level is not set to custom, this value is ignored. Therefore, only shares with custom values can be compared.
There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other resource pools.
Shares are used in case of resource contention.
Valid values - Integer

The allocation level. The level is a simplified view of shares. Levels map to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, then the level is set as custom.
Shares are used in case of resource contention.
Valid values - custom, high, low, normal

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <parameters> <resource-pool>${parent res pool}</resource-pool> <name>${name}</name> <spec> <cpu-allocation> <xsl:if test="'${cpu reservation}' != ''"> <reservation>${cpu reservation}</reservation> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${cpu expandable reservation}' != ''"> <expandable-reservation>${cpu expandable reservation}</expandable-reservation> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${cpu limit}' != ''"> <limit>${cpu limit}</limit> </xsl:if> <shares> <xsl:if test="'${cpu shares}' != ''"> <shares>${cpu shares}</shares> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${cpu shares level}' != ''"> <level>${cpu shares level}</level> </xsl:if> </shares> </cpu-allocation> <memory-allocation> <xsl:if test="'${memory reservation}' != ''"> <reservation>${memory reservation}</reservation> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${memory expandable reservation}' != ''"> <expandable-reservation>${memory expandable reservation}</expandable-reservation> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${memory limit}' != ''"> <limit>${memory limit}</limit> </xsl:if> <shares> <xsl:if test="'${memory shares}' != ''"> <shares>${memory shares}</shares> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${memory shares level}' != ''"> <level>${memory shares level}</level> </xsl:if> </shares> </memory-allocation> </spec> </parameters> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
